importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: Dr Hussam Abu Safia was arrested by Israeli forces on this date after a raid on Kamal Adwan Hospital, one of the last functioning medical facilities in North Gaza.
This date marks the end of the period covered by Human Rights Watch’s documentation of detained Palestinian healthcare workers, with 431 cases reported between October 7, 2023, and October 20, 2025.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: Between October 7, 2023, and October 20, 2025, Human Rights Watch documented 431 cases of Palestinian healthcare workers detained by Israeli forces, highlighting a sustained pattern of abduction and detention.

keyTakeAways: At least 95 Palestinian healthcare workers are currently held captive by Israeli authorities, with 80 from Gaza and 15 from the West Bank.
The majority of detainees were abducted from hospitals or ambulances while on duty, indicating a pattern of targeting medical personnel during active conflict.
Dr Hussam Abu Safia, director of Kamal Adwan Hospital in North Gaza, was arrested on December 27, 2024, and remains detained without charge or trial under Israel’s Unlawful Combatants Law.
According to testimonies, detainees face torture, physical abuse, denial of medical care, and degrading treatment, violating international humanitarian law.
At least 1,722 healthcare workers have been killed in Israeli strikes over the past two years, and more than 431 have been detained, severely weakening Gaza’s healthcare system.
The average detention period for those still held is 511 days, with many detained since the early weeks of the war.
Of the 95 detained, 31 are nurses, 17 are physicians, 15 are hospital support staff, 14 are paramedics, two are pharmacists, and one is a medical technician. Most are male and from North Gaza.
Families of 22 detained healthcare workers have not received updates, indicating a lack of transparency or communication from Israeli authorities.

Human Rights Watch and Amnesty International UK have called for immediate and unconditional release of all detained healthcare workers, citing violations of international law and severe human rights abuses.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The article reports on the ongoing detention of at least 95 Palestinian healthcare workers by Israeli authorities, including Dr Hussam Abu Safia, director of Kamal Adwan Hospital in North Gaza, who was arrested on December 27, 2024. Most detainees were abducted from hospitals or ambulances while on duty, and face severe abuse, torture, and denial of medical care. Human Rights Watch and Amnesty International UK have documented over 431 such cases from October 2023 to October 2025, with at least 1,722 healthcare workers killed in Israeli strikes. The average detention period is 511 days, and families of 22 detainees have not received updates. The situation is seen as a clear violation of international humanitarian law, with global protests, such as one at St Thomas’ Hospital in London, calling for immediate and unconditional release.
